Happy Birthday to me

I have not been visiting this page since facebox was changed to pan.net Few reasons. First, I was so busy with work. Second, I have a cousin and her friend staying with me temporarily. My time has been taken to make them more comfortable and at home. Interestingly, having them around made me appreciate my privacy and my loneliness. Third, I've been running around - my brother has a daughter now, my cousin got pregnant, and my sister now in Uni. Whatever time left I have on my hand I focused on them. Fourth, I've been writing again. I'm writing episodes 25-40 of Duranni (it's shown on Astro). Frankly, I've not seen the episodes yet although my sister said that it's kinda good. Lastly, finally I bring myself to exercise....yep..... 2 yoga classes per week. My body is now more flexible than 1 month ago..hahaha...

Anyways, last 18th July was my birthday. I declared it as my public holiday. So after 9.30 am I did not logon to my computer. I spent one whole day with my cousin. We watched movie and had a nice dinner at Fasta Pasta (my favourite restaurant). It was almost a perfect day.

What is my resolution? Be thankful....eat well, read more, exercise, be close to Allah, love my family more, laugh with my friends more often, and may be..... open my heart for love. If I'm not going to live until my next year's birthday, I'd like to know that I've lived well and loved people around me unconditionally.

Selamat Hari Raya, Maaf Zahir Batin

To all Muslims out there..

Every Hari Raya, our Muslim friends will use a greeting so simple in its execution, many forget its significance. The greeting 'maaf zahir batin' which translatesloosely to 'I seek forgiveness (from you) physically and spiritually' for Hari Raya means a time to reconcile and renew relationships with others.

Forgiveness is something we should all practise. Not just for Hari Raya but every day. We should celbrate it and embrace it as an essential part of our lives.

There is nothing so bad that cannot be forgiven. Hurt will never heal until you forgive.

If you are at war with others, you cannot be at peace with yourself. You can let go and forgive. It takes no physical strength to let go, only courage.

Forgiveness is the single most important process that can bring peace to our souls and harmony to our lives. Forgiveness is not something we have to strain ourselves to do. Forgiveness helps you move forward. No one benefits from the forgiveness more than one who forgives.

Give yourselves the gift of forgiveness today. Maaf zahir batin to all.

"The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong" - Mahatma Gandhi

TGIF

Friday is here... last day of the working day for the week, the king of the week, as referred by muslims. It has been a bitter sweet and to a certain extent, a struggling week for me. This week is the first time I'm living by myself after my cousin moved out to join his hubby whom she newly wed last Sunday.

I thought I'll enjoy the space as I can have all the apartment to myself now. Plus, this is the first time I'm not answerable to anyone on what time I'll come home everyday, I don't have to crack my head on what to eat for dinner which need to suit both mine and her requirements, I don't have to bother that someone will nag me that my laundry is not folded after 2 days it's dried. I don't have to cringe that the house was not kept according to my standard. I also can escape all the fights that my things are misplaced by her.

But the emptiness she left overweighed the freedom of being alone and independent. While decorating her rooms for the nikah, I playfully teased her that at last, I can get rid of her from my life. In fact I sang her the song "At last" which I put in some words to make it relevant to us. We laughed at it but on the day I came home the reality hit.

So there's a truth in what the wisemen say. You won't appreciate things until it's lost. While I can get used to not having the nagging from her.. but I missed all the little things like fighting over TV channel (as she is an ESPN, StarSports viewer while I'm more a Starworld & AXN fan..and usually I have to lost my favourite programme to her Soccer/tennis game), the talks or bitching sessions, and the ability to look into each other and laugh as we know what is going on each other's head (usually happen when we are looking at certain people on the street who act weird...)

Although the house is now kept according to my requirement, and I can tell where are my things now...but I think having certain things misplaced once in a while is not a bad thing after all.........

To Kak Faz, Selamat pengantin baru. Miss you like hell .. and forever love you. You're the best sis that anyone could ask for!

To all...live well..laugh a lot!

Old acquaintance...

I went out lunch with my former highschool friend. We have not seen each other for almost 4-5 months. It's good to catch up with old acquaintance. I like this friend a lot and I admire her courage, passion and persistence in re-uniting old friends.

Actually I got to know her very close when I was in form 5. After SPM we still keep in touch during the break while waiting the result. Once the result out, I continued my studies in Malaysia while she went abroad. Eventhough we tried to keep in touch, but we were defeated by time and distance.

On my 2nd-3rd year working, I got an e-mail in my hotmail who asked me whether I'm the person that she went to school with. She just managed to locate me by searching in hotmail address book (we used to be able to do that before....)

Since then we make a point to see each other may be at least once a year ( better than not seeing each other at all) and always get connected via YM.

Other than me..she has been contacting some other school friends and had been initiating reunions etc. Seriously, if not because of her, I don't think I will spend time to get reconnected with old friends. La... you're a good friend... Love always

I don't get it when people just come to work or meeting late without feeling any guilt. I don't understand when people make mistake and finger point. I don't know why people cannot be truthful.. What went wrong? Poor upbringing? Lack of education ..or simply stupid?

Hmmmmmmmmm ..one of life wonders.

SPM results

I received a call from my mom 2 days ago. She asked me, "Quick..what burger will make you happy?" I said, "Duh... all burger make me happy, if they are delicious". She replied, "C'mon humour me.... what burger will make US happy?". So I said, " I don't know... Mc Donalds...?". And my mom happily said that, "Silly you.... it won't make you that happy..!". About now I lost my patience, "Cepat la Ma... what is the answer..?", which she replied..." The burger that will make us happy is BERGEMBIRA"... Wassup with that?????!!!

So I know that she has good news for me. So I asked her about my little sister's SPM result.And my mom told me she scored 8 As and 3Bs. Good for her. And she scored A1s for Maths, Add Maths and Accounts!!! Geee.... how nerd can she be? Sorry Kak Chik ..lawak je ...

So to all SPM leavers...for those who did well, congratulations, and for those who didn't it's not the end of the road. Try harder next time.

The gift of tears

Early this morning I accidentally switched to channel TV3. This psychologist was talking about crying as a therapy. It shocked me when she said that a person who cries a lot is balanced. He he he . Actually, I have considered myself as an emotionally unstable person since I can cry even on small things.

I cry watching all sad movies and even not so sad movies. I cried everytime I saw how Meredith Grey sufferred in Grey's Anatomy. At one point, my cousin used to put her finger on my cheek everytime there's sad scene on TV/cinema, to check whether my tears spilled over. And I'm so ashamed to reveal that I sobbed fiercefully watching Lion King.. until the person who sits next to me looked as if I'm a psychopath.

Then, I cried when I lost my dear ones. I cried when I lost my grandma. At age 9, when I sat myself next to her in the center of the living room where she was placed unconsiously, I called her name and cried. And you know what.. I made the entire kampung cried with my act . I also cried when I lost Chandler, my dearest cat. I sobbed so hard that I thought I'll lost my breath. I read my last prayers for him (and Yassin too) before carrying him to my aunt's house in Seremban. I put him on my lap while my cousin drove us back and I cried all the way to Seremban. Until now, 1 year after his death, I still mourn over the loss and missed him hiding in my blanket while I was asleep.

Then again, the therapist could have been right. According to a hadith, the prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) proclaimed: "This (tears) is an expression of the tenderness and compassion, which the Lord hath put into the hearts of His servants. The Lord doth not have compassion on and commiserate with His servants, except such as are tender and full of feeling."

So if balanced it is...... I'll accept it with humbleness....

Taking a break

When married people can't see eye to eye with their other halves, instead of going for a divorce, some get separated; a time to be away from each other. Time needed for a breather, to have chance to analyse things objectively without having a need to go into fights and heart aches; an opportunity to remedy pain.. a chance to think about the future - to still fight for the marriage or to let it go.

For those who are still dating..they take a break. This path sometime lead to reconciliation but to some it leads to further distance of two hearts.

But what happened if true friendship is tested? When the respect is diminishing and the trust is draining? When 99% of the time, good intentions are misintepreted? When your sincerity is always questioned? When accusation becomes the language rather than compliment? Can the 2 friends stand stedfastly to the friendship that they have been successfully hold on for years?

My dear friend and I decided that we need to take a break from each other for 2 months. This break is much needed before our relationship getting worsen and beyond save.

Remember when we are young and we used to get FRANCE in our autograph? Well if this friendship is truely meant to last.. I do hope what I got from my autograph will come into reality - Friendship Remains And Never Can End.......

Food to our souls

I've stumbled into one blog which I would highly recommend to all of you who are looking for food to your souls. The blog is full of content and have very good materials. http://yahumaira.wordpress.com

Below is the excerpt from the book titled "Don't be Sad" or in Arabic "La Tahzan" that was published in this blog. Praise to Allah for the peace that He bestowed upon us.

This wonderful words made want me to get the book. May what you read here could touch you as much as it touches me. Take care everyone...

**********************************
To bow is to be like the willow, and to not return force is to be like the oak tree. The believer is like the green plant; the wind blows it to the left and to the right. The wise person is like water, for water does not crash into a rock, trying to pass through it. Instead, it comes to it from the left and from the right, from above and from below. The believer is like a camel whose reins are on its nose. If it were made to kneel on a rock, it would do so. Search for happiness inside of you and not around you or outside you. This life does not deserve our grief. O’ Allah, make me pleased with Your decree, so that I may know that whatever has befallen me was not meant to miss me and what has passed me by, was not meant to be in my lot. As long as you have faith in Allah, do not be sad. Faith in Allah, the Al-Mighty, is to happiness and peace while disbelief is to confusion and misery. The element that influences nature is the active intellect (Ibn Seena). By Allah I felt not your landing on me! Then how will I feel you when you fly away. The ideal person is he who takes pleasure in serving others, who is ashamed when others do things for him, since showing compassion is a sign of superiority, while receiving is a sign of failure (Aristotle).
